alert.note: Alert for Independence; Jackson; Lawrence (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 21 at 7:53PM CST until February 25 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Arkansas... Black River At Black Rock affecting Lawrence, Independence and Jackson Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River At Black Rock. * WHEN...Until Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Farm ground along east bank begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 15.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage on Friday afternoon; however, additional rainfall could change this forecast. Stay up to date to the latest info regarding this river and site. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 6 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Crest Time Date Black River Black Rock 14.0 15.6 Tue 7 PM 15.0 14.4 13.9 **FALLING** &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
